00020 /*
00021  * \file   tsv-test.cpp
00022  * \brief  Tests for TsvFile reading and writing.
00023  *         This program checks that TsvFile is working as expected.
00024  */

00042 void
00043 check_trim()
00044 {
00045   std::string trimstr1=" \t1 2 3\t ";
00046   std::string trimstr1s="     1 2 3     ";
00047   std::string trimstr2;
00048 
00049   trimstr2=trimstr1;
00050   ltrim(trimstr2);
00051   //printf("ltrim: '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00052   assert(trimstr2=="1 2 3\t ");
00053 
00054   trimstr2=trimstr1s;
00055   rtrim(trimstr2);
00056   //printf("rtrim: '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00057   assert(trimstr2=="     1 2 3");
00058 
00059   trimstr2=trimstr1;
00060   rtrim(trimstr2);
00061   //printf("rtrim: '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00062   assert(trimstr2==" \t1 2 3");
00063 
00064   trimstr2=trimstr1;
00065   trim(trimstr2);
00066   //printf("trim:  '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00067   assert(trimstr2=="1 2 3");
00068 
00069   trimstr2="abc";
00070   trim(trimstr2);
00071   //printf("trim:  '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00072   assert(trimstr2=="abc");
00073 
00074   trimstr2="";
00075   trim(trimstr2);
00076   //printf("trim:  '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00077   assert(trimstr2=="");
00078 }
00079 
00081 #define CHECK_DEQUOTE(Xstr1,Xstr2) \
00082   str1=Xstr1; \
00083   str2=str1;  \
00084   dequote(str2); \
00085   if (0) printf("dequote('%s')=='%s'\n",str1.c_str(),str2.c_str());  \
00086   assert(str2==Xstr2);
00087 
00089 void
00090 check_dequote()
00091 {
00092   std::string str1;
00093   std::string str2;
00094 
00095   CHECK_DEQUOTE("abc","abc");
00096   CHECK_DEQUOTE("'abc'","abc");
00097   CHECK_DEQUOTE("'abc","'abc");
00098   CHECK_DEQUOTE("abc'","abc'");
00099   CHECK_DEQUOTE("''","");
00100   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\"","\"");
00101   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\'","\'");
00102   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\"abc\"","abc");
00103   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\'abc\"","\'abc\"");
00104   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\"abc\'","\"abc\'");
00105 }

00109 void
00110 check_splitstr_print(std::vector<std::string>& strvec)
00111 {
00112   printf("#---\n");
00113   for (unsigned int i=0;i<strvec.size();++i) {
00114     printf("%3d:%s\n",i,strvec[i].c_str());
00115   }
00116 }
00117 
00119 void
00120 check_splitstr()
00121 {
00122   std::vector<std::string> strvec;
00123   std::string str;
00124 
00125   str="a-b-c"; // ("a","b","c")
00126   splitstr(str,'-',strvec);
00127   //check_splitstr_print(strvec);
00128   assert(strvec.size()==3);
00129 
00130   str=""; // ("")
00131   splitstr(str,'-',strvec);
00132   //check_splitstr_print(strvec);
00133   assert(strvec.size()==1);
00134 
00135   str="-"; // ("","")
00136   splitstr(str,'-',strvec);
00137   //check_splitstr_print(strvec);
00138   assert(strvec.size()==2);
00139 }
00140 
00141 void
00142 check_escapeString()
00143 {
00144   //printf("check_escapeString()\n");
00145 
00146   // negative controls
00147   assert(escapeChar('A')==0);
00148   assert(escapeChar('Z')==0);
00149   assert(escapeChar('a')==0);
00150   assert(escapeChar('z')==0);
00151   //
00152   assert(escapeChar('\n')=='n');
00153   assert(escapeChar('\r')=='r');
00154   assert(escapeChar('#')=='#');
00155 
00156   // 
00157   assert(escapeString("A",'\\')=="A");
00158   assert(escapeString("Z",'\\')=="Z");
00159   assert(escapeString("",'\\')=="");
00160   assert(escapeString("abc",'\\')=="abc");
00161   // postive
00162   assert(escapeString("#",'\\')=="\\#");
00163 }

00166 void
00167 check_field_name()
00168 {
00169   affx::TsvFile* tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00170   std::string cname;
00171   int cidx;
00172 
00173   cname="abc";
00174   tsv->defineColumn(0,1,cname);
00175   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname);
00176   //printf("0:%s=%d\n",cname.c_str(),cidx);
00177   assert(cidx==1);
00178 
00179   cname="def";
00180   tsv->defineColumn(0,10,cname);
00181   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname);
00182   //printf("0:%s=%d\n",cname.c_str(),cidx);
00183   assert(cidx==10);
00184 
00185   // Make sure the alias finds it
00186   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1",cname);
00187   assert(cidx==10);
00188   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2",cname);
00189   assert(cidx==10);
00190   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2","bogus3",cname);
00191   assert(cidx==10);
00192 
00193   //
00194   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname,"bogus1");
00195   assert(cidx==10);
00196   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname,"bogus1","bogus2");
00197   assert(cidx==10);
00198   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname,"bogus1","bogus2","bogus3");
00199   assert(cidx==10);
00200 
00201   //
00202   cname="xyz";
00203   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname);
00204   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00205 
00206   // Make sure the alias dont find it
00207   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1",cname);
00208   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00209   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2",cname);
00210   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00211   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2","bogus3",cname);
00212   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00213 
00214   //
00215   delete tsv;
00216 }

00218 void
00219 check_empty()
00220 {
00221   affx::TsvFileField col;
00222   
00223   //
00224   col.clear();
00225   assert(col.isNull()==true);
00226   assert(col.isEmpty()==true);
00227 
00228   //
00229   col.setBuffer("");
00230   assert(col.isNull()==false);
00231   assert(col.isEmpty()==true);
00232 
00233   //
00234   col.setBuffer("abc");
00235   assert(col.isNull()==false);
00236   assert(col.isEmpty()==false);
00237 }

00240 void
00241 check_field_convert()
00242 {
00243   affx::TsvFileField col;
00244   double val_double;
00245   int val_int;
00246   int rv;
00247 
00248   // a good int conversion
00249   col.clear();
00250   col.setBuffer("123");
00251   rv=col.get(&val_int);
00252   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_int==123));
00253   rv=col.get(&val_int);
00254   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_int==123));
00255 
00256   // a bad int conversion
00257   col.clear();
00258   col.setBuffer("abc");
00259   rv=col.get(&val_int);
00260   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00261   rv=col.get(&val_int);
00262   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00263 
00264   // a bad int conversion
00265   col.clear();
00266   col.setBuffer("123.4");
00267   rv=col.get(&val_int);
00268   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00269   rv=col.get(&val_int);
00270   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00271 
00272 
00273   // a good double conversion
00274   col.clear();
00275   col.setBuffer("123.5");
00276   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00277   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5));
00278   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00279   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5));
00280 
00281   // exponent
00282   col.clear();
00283   col.setBuffer("123.5e6");
00284   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00285   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5e6));
00286   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00287   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5e6));
00288 
00289   // a bad double conversion
00290   col.clear();
00291   col.setBuffer("abc");
00292   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00293   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00294   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00295   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00296 
00297   // bad partial
00298   col.setBuffer("123abc");
00299   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00300   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00301   rv=col.get(&val_double);
00302   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00303 
00304 
00305   /*
00306   for (int p=0;p<5;p++) {
00307     col.clear();
00308     col.setPrecision(p);
00309     col.set(-1.0);
00310     std::string buf;
00311     col.get(&buf);
00312     printf("%d: col val='%s'\n",p,buf.c_str());
00313   }
00314   */
00315 }

00317 void
00318 check_field_vec_convert()
00319 {
00320   affx::TsvFileField col;
00321   int rv;
00322 
00323 #define TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(TYPE) do {                         \
00324     std::vector<TYPE> out_vec_##TYPE;                           \
00325     rv=col.get(&out_vec_##TYPE,',');                            \
00326     assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(out_vec_##TYPE.size()==3)&&           \
00327            (out_vec_##TYPE[0]==123)&&(out_vec_##TYPE[2]==789)); \
00328   } while(0)
00329 
00330   // a good int conversion
00331   col.clear();
00332   col.setBuffer("123,456,789");
00333   //
00334   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(int);
00335   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(float);
00336   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(double);
00337 
00338   col.setBuffer(" 123 , 456 , 789 ");
00339   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(int);
00340   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(float);
00341   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(double);
00342 
00343   col.setBuffer(" 123 ,, 789 ");
00344   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(int);
00345   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(float);
00346   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(double);
00347 
00348   col.setBuffer(" 123 , , 789 ");
00349   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(int);
00350   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(float);
00351   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123(double);
00352 
00353 #undef TEST_VEC_CONVERT_123
00354 
00355   //
00356   std::vector<std::string> out_vec_string;
00357   col.setBuffer("abc,def,ghi");
00358   rv=col.get(&out_vec_string);
00359   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&
00360          (out_vec_string.size()==3)&&
00361          (out_vec_string[0]=="abc")&&
00362          (out_vec_string[1]=="def")&&
00363          (out_vec_string[2]=="ghi"));
00364 
00365   //
00366   col.setBuffer("");
00367   rv=col.get(&out_vec_string);
00368   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&
00369          (out_vec_string.size()==0));
00370 
00371   col.setBuffer(",");
00372   rv=col.get(&out_vec_string);
00373   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&
00374          (out_vec_string.size()==2)&&
00375          (out_vec_string[0]=="")&&
00376          (out_vec_string[1]==""));
00377 
00378   //
00379   col.setBuffer("");
00380 
00381 #define TEST_VEC_CONVERT_BLANK(TYPE) do {                       \
00382     std::vector<TYPE> out_vec_##TYPE;                           \
00383     rv=col.get(&out_vec_##TYPE,',');                            \
00384     assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(out_vec_##TYPE.size()==0));           \
00385   } while (0)
00386 
00387   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_BLANK(int);
00388   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_BLANK(float);
00389   TEST_VEC_CONVERT_BLANK(double);
00390 
00391 #undef TEST_VEC_CONVERT_BLANK
00392 
00393   std::vector<int> in_vec_int_0;
00394   //
00395   col.set("abc");
00396   //
00397   in_vec_int_0.clear();
00398   col.set(in_vec_int_0,',');
00399   assert(col.m_buffer=="");
00400   
00401   std::vector<int> in_vec_int_1(1,123);
00402   col.set(in_vec_int_1,',');
00403   assert(col.m_buffer=="123");
00404 
00405   std::vector<int> in_vec_int_2(2,123);
00406   col.set(in_vec_int_2,',');
00407   assert(col.m_buffer=="123,123");
00408 
00409   //
00410   std::vector<std::string> in_vec_str_1;
00411   col.set(in_vec_str_1,':');
00412   assert(col.m_buffer=="");
00413   //
00414   in_vec_str_1.push_back("abc");
00415   col.set(in_vec_str_1,':');
00416   assert(col.m_buffer=="abc");
00417   //
00418   in_vec_str_1.push_back("def");   
00419   in_vec_str_1.push_back("ghi");
00420   //
00421   col.set(in_vec_str_1);
00422   assert(col.m_buffer=="abc,def,ghi");
00423   col.set(in_vec_str_1,':');
00424   assert(col.m_buffer=="abc:def:ghi");
00425 
00426   //
00427   std::vector<double> in_vec_d_1;
00428   col.setPrecision(6);
00429   col.set(in_vec_d_1,':');
00430   assert(col.m_buffer=="");
00431   //
00432   in_vec_d_1.push_back(1.0);
00433   col.set(in_vec_d_1);
00434   //printf("### m_buffer='%s'\n",col.m_buffer.c_str());
00435   assert(col.m_buffer=="1.000000");
00436   //
00437   in_vec_d_1.push_back(2.0000091);   
00438   in_vec_d_1.push_back(3.0000011);
00439   //
00440   col.set(in_vec_d_1);
00441   //printf("### m_buffer='%s'\n",col.m_buffer.c_str());
00442   assert(col.m_buffer=="1.000000,2.000009,3.000001");
00443 }
00444 
00446 void
00447 check_headers_1()
00448 {
00449   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00450   std::string key;
00451   std::string val;
00452 
00453   // should be empty at start
00454   tsv.headersBegin();
00455   while (tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
00456     assert(0);
00457   }
00458 
00459   // add one and get the value.
00460   std::string test_str_in="test_val";
00461   std::string test_str_out;
00462   tsv.addHeader("test_str_1",test_str_in);
00463   tsv.getHeader("test_str_1",test_str_out);
00464   assert(test_str_out==test_str_in);
00465   // should fail.
00466   assert(tsv.getHeader("test_str_none",test_str_out)!=TSV_OK);
00467 
00468   int test_int_in=123;
00469   int test_int_out=0;
00470   tsv.addHeader("test_int_1",test_int_in);
00471   tsv.getHeader("test_int_1",test_int_out);
00472   assert(test_int_out==test_int_in);
00473   //
00474   assert(tsv.getHeader("test_int_none",test_int_out)!=TSV_OK);
00475 
00476   double test_double_in=123.456;
00477   double test_double_out=0;
00478   tsv.addHeader("test_double_1",test_double_in);
00479   tsv.getHeader("test_double_1",test_double_out);
00480   assert(test_double_out==test_double_in);
00481   // should fail
00482   assert(tsv.getHeader("test_double_none",test_double_out)!=TSV_OK);
00483 
00484   // They should remain in the order added.
00485   for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00486     tsv.addHeader("a",i);
00487     tsv.addHeader("b",i);
00488     tsv.addHeader("c",i);
00489     tsv.addHeaderComment("comment");
00490   }
00491   //tsv.dump_headers();
00492 
00493   //
00494   assert(tsv.hasHeaderEqualTo("a","1")==TSV_OK);
00495   assert(tsv.hasHeaderEqualTo("c","1")==TSV_OK);
00496   //
00497   assert(tsv.hasHeaderEqualTo("a","99")==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00498   assert(tsv.hasHeaderEqualTo("d","1")==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00499 
00500   //
00501   tsv.headersBegin();
00502   for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00503     tsv.headersFindNext("b",val);
00504     assert(i==strtol(val.c_str(),NULL,0));
00505   }
00506 
00507   // no header returned by headersNext should be blank
00508   tsv.headersBegin();
00509   while (tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
00510     //printf("#%s=%s\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
00511     assert(key!="");
00512   }
00513 }
00514 
00516 
00518 void
00519 check_read_table_1()
00520 {
00521   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00522   int val_ref=0;
00523   int val_col;
00524 
00525   tsv.openTable("data-table-1.txt");
00526 
00527   assert(tsv.countTotalDataLines()==10);
00528 
00529   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00530     int cidx=0;
00531     //printf("num=%3d: lvl=%3d:",tsv.lineNumber(),tsv.lineLevel());
00532     while ((cidx<tsv.getColumnCount(tsv.lineLevel())) &&
00533            (tsv.get(tsv.lineLevel(),cidx,val_col)==TSV_OK)) {
00534       //printf("%s(%d=%d)",((cidx==0)?"":"\t"),val_ref,val_col);
00535       assert(val_col==val_ref);
00536       val_ref++;
00537       cidx++;
00538     }
00539     //printf("\n");
00540   }
00541   tsv.close();
00542 }

00545 
00547 void
00548 check_headers_2()
00549 {
00550   affx::TsvFile tsv_a;
00551   affx::TsvFile tsv_z;
00552   affx::TsvFile tsv_0;
00553   std::string key;
00554   std::string val;
00555   std::string val_out;
00556   int val_out_int;
00557   int i;
00558   int i_max=10;
00559   int rv;
00560 
00561   rv=tsv_a.getHeader("No header",val);
00562   assert(rv==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00563 
00564   for (i=0;i<i_max;i++) {
00565     std::ostringstream stream;
00566     stream << i;
00567     val=stream.str();
00568     key="key_"+val;
00569     tsv_a.addHeader(key,val,i);
00570     tsv_a.addHeaderComment("123");
00571     tsv_z.addHeader(key,val,i_max-i-1);
00572     tsv_0.addHeader(key,val,0);
00573     tsv_0.addHeaderComment(val);
00574     //
00575     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key,val);
00576     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00577     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key+"not found",val);
00578     assert(rv==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00579   }
00580   assert(tsv_a.headerCount()==(2*i_max));
00581 
00582   //
00583   //tsv_a.dump_headers();
00584   //tsv_z.dump_headers();
00585   assert((tsv_z.headerCount())==(1*i_max));
00586   tsv_z.resortHeaders();
00587   assert((tsv_z.headerCount())==(1*i_max));
00588   //tsv_z.dump_headers();
00589 
00590   // should be in the correct order
00591   for (i=0;i<10;i++) {
00592     std::ostringstream stream;
00593     stream << i;
00594     val=stream.str();
00595     key="key_"+val;
00596 
00597     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key,val_out);
00598     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00599     assert(val_out==val);
00600 
00601     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key,val_out_int);
00602     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00603     assert(val_out_int==i);
00604 
00605     rv=tsv_z.getHeader(key,val_out);
00606     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00607     assert(val_out==val);
00608   }
00609   //
00610   tsv_a.writeTsv("check-a.tsv");
00611   tsv_a.close();
00612   tsv_z.writeTsv("check-z.tsv");
00613   tsv_z.close();
00614   tsv_0.writeTsv("check-0.tsv");
00615   tsv_0.close();
00616 }
00617 
00618 void
00619 check_comment_1()
00620 {
00621   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00622   std::string filename="./check-comment.tsv";
00623   std::string comment="comment for testing";
00624 
00625   //
00626   assert(tsv.writeTsv(filename)==affx::TSV_OK);
00627   assert(tsv.writeFileComment(comment)==affx::TSV_OK);
00628   tsv.close();
00629   //
00630   tsv.open(filename);
00631   tsv.headersBegin();
00632   TsvFileHeaderLine* hdr;
00633   int hdr_cnt=0;
00634   int hdr_found=0;
00635   while ((hdr=tsv.nextHeaderPtr())!=NULL) {
00636     // printf("hdr='%s'\n",hdr->m_value.c_str());
00637     hdr_cnt++;
00638     if ((hdr->m_key=="") && (hdr->m_value==comment)) {
00639       hdr_found++;
00640     }
00641   }
00642   //
00643   assert((hdr_cnt==1)&&(hdr_found==1));
00644   //
00645   tsv.close();
00646 }
00647 
00648 #define CH2_CNT 10
00649 
00651 void
00652 check_headers_3()
00653 {
00654   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00655   int rv;
00656 
00657   for (int i=0;i<CH2_CNT;i++) {
00658     tsv.addHeader("abc",i);
00659   }
00660 
00661   std::string val;
00662   tsv.headersBegin();
00663   for (int i=0;i<CH2_CNT;i++) {
00664     rv=tsv.headersFindNext("abc",val);
00665     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00666   }
00667 
00668   rv=tsv.headersFindNext("abc",val);
00669   assert(rv!=TSV_OK);
00670 
00671   //
00672   rv=tsv.headersFindNext("def",val);
00673   assert(rv!=TSV_OK);
00674   rv=tsv.headersFindNext("abc",val);
00675   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00676 }
00677 
00678 void
00679 check_headers_4()
00680 {
00681   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00682   int rv;
00683 
00684   // add some headers "abc" and "ghi" are bookends.
00685   tsv.addHeader("abc",0);
00686   for (int i=0;i<5;i++) {
00687     tsv.addHeader("def",i);
00688   }
00689   tsv.addHeader("ghi",11);
00690 
00691   //tsv.dump_headers();
00692 
00693   // get rid of the middle ones.
00694   tsv.deleteHeaders("def");
00695   //tsv.dump_headers();
00696   rv=tsv.headersCount();
00697   assert(rv==2);
00698   // tsv.dump_headers();
00699   
00700   // shouldnt crash
00701   tsv.deleteHeaders("def");
00702   rv=tsv.headersCount();
00703   assert(rv==2);
00704 
00705   //
00706   tsv.deleteHeaders("abc");
00707   rv=tsv.headersCount();
00708   assert(rv==1);
00709 
00710   //
00711   tsv.deleteHeaders("ghi");
00712   rv=tsv.headersCount();
00713   assert(rv==0);
00714 }

00718 
00720 void
00721 check_csv_1()
00722 {
00723   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00724   int rv;
00725   std::string tmpstr;
00726   double tmpdbl;
00727 
00728   //rv=tsv.openCsv("./data-test-2.csv");
00729   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-2.csv");
00730   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00731 
00732   //printf("check_csv_1: lines=%d\n",tsv.countTotalDataLines());
00733   assert(tsv.countTotalDataLines()==10);
00734 
00735   //tsv.dump();
00736 
00737   // The first four lines are all variations of "1,2,3"
00738   for (int i=0;i<4;i++) {
00739     rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00740     //printf("check_csv_1: line=%3d:",i);
00741     tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr);
00742     //printf(" '%s',",tmpstr.c_str());
00743     //printf("\n");
00744     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="1"));
00745     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpdbl); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpdbl==1.0));
00746     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="2"));
00747     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpdbl); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpdbl==2.0));
00748     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="3"));
00749     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpdbl); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpdbl==3.0));
00750     //
00751     assert(tsv.isNull(0,2)==false);
00752     assert(tsv.isNull(0,"header-03")==false);
00753     assert(tsv.isEmpty(0,2)==false);
00754     assert(tsv.isEmpty(0,"header-03")==false);
00755   }
00756 
00757   for (int i=0;i<2;i++) {
00758     rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00759     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\"1\""));
00760     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\"2\""));
00761     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\"3\""));
00762   }
00763 
00764   // a mixed up line ("1",",","3\"")
00765   rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00766   rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr==",1"));
00767   rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr==","));
00768   rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\""));
00769 
00770   // escaped field seps. ("1,",",2",3\,4)
00771   for (int i=0;i<2;i++) {
00772     rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00773     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="1,\""));
00774     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr==",2'"));
00775     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="3,4"));
00776   }
00777 
00778   // check we are at the end -- move to the next line and get it.
00779   // # next line is end of file
00780   rv=tsv.nextLine();
00781   assert((rv==TSV_OK));
00782   //assert((tsv.lineLevel()==TSV_LINE_COMMENT));
00783   // end-of-file
00784   rv=tsv.nextLine();
00785   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(tsv.lineLevel()==0));
00786   rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr);
00787   assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="end-of-file"));
00788 
00789   tsv.close();
00790 }
00791 
00793 void
00794 check_nextline()
00795 {
00796   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00797   int rv;
00798 
00799   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-2.csv");
00800   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00801 
00802   while ((rv=tsv.nextLine())==TSV_OK) {
00803     printf(" %3d : %3d\n",tsv.lineNumber(),tsv.lineLevel());
00804   }
00805   tsv.close();
00806 }

00808 
00810 void
00811 check_index_1()
00812 {
00813   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00814   int rv;
00815   int file_key,file_val;
00816 
00817   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-3.tsv");
00818   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00819 
00820   rv=tsv.defineIndex(0,"key",TSV_INDEX_INT,0);
00821   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00822 
00823   // negative control
00824   rv=tsv.findBegin(0,"key",TSV_OP_EQ,999);
00825   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00826   rv=tsv.findNext();
00827   assert(rv==TSV_FIND_LAST);
00828 
00829   // positive
00830   for (int key=1;key<10;key++) {
00831     rv=tsv.findBegin(0,"key",TSV_OP_EQ,key);
00832     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00833 
00834     int num_found=0;
00835     while (tsv.findNext()==TSV_OK) {
00836       num_found++;
00837       //
00838       rv=tsv.get(0,"key",file_key);
00839       assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00840       rv=tsv.get(0,"val",file_val);
00841       assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00842       //printf(" %2d : %2d => %2d\n",key,file_key,file_val);
00843       assert(file_key==key);
00844       assert(file_val==(101*key));
00845     }
00846     assert(num_found==1);
00847   }
00848   tsv.close();
00849 }

00852 void
00853 check_winpath_1()
00854 {
00855   int rv;
00856   std::string pathname;
00857   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00858   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-winpath.txt");
00859   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00860   tsv.m_optEscapeOk=false;
00861 
00862   tsv.nextLevel(0);
00863   rv=tsv.get(0,"pathname",pathname);
00864   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00865   //printf("pathname='%s'\n",pathname.c_str());
00866   assert(pathname=="C:\\some\\path\\to\\a\\file.txt");
00867 
00868   tsv.close();
00869 }

00872 
00873 void check_read_vec_1()
00874 {
00875   int rv;
00876   std::vector<int> vec_i;
00877 
00878   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00879   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-4.tsv");
00880   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00881 
00882   tsv.nextLevel(0);
00883 
00884   rv=tsv.get(0,"col_00",&vec_i);
00885   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(vec_i.size()==3)&&(vec_i[0]=1)&&(vec_i[2]==3));
00886   
00887   rv=tsv.get(0,"col_01",&vec_i);
00888   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(vec_i.size()==3)&&(vec_i[0]=4)&&(vec_i[2]==6));
00889 
00890   tsv.nextLevel(0);
00891 
00892   rv=tsv.get(0,"col_00",&vec_i);
00893   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(vec_i.size()==3)&&(vec_i[0]=7)&&(vec_i[2]==9));
00894   
00895   rv=tsv.get(0,"col_01",&vec_i,':');
00896   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(vec_i.size()==3)&&(vec_i[0]=10)&&(vec_i[2]==12));
00897 
00898   tsv.nextLevel(0);
00899   std::string tmp_str;
00900   std::vector<double> tmp_vec_d;
00901   
00902   rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmp_str);
00903   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(tmp_str=="7.005,8.123,9.100"));
00904   tsv.get(0,0,&tmp_vec_d);
00905   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(tmp_vec_d.size()==3)&&
00906          (tmp_vec_d[0]==7.005)&&(tmp_vec_d[1]==8.123)&&(tmp_vec_d[2]==9.100));;
00907 
00908   rv=tsv.get(0,"col_01",tmp_str);
00909   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(tmp_str=="7.005005:8.123456:9.100000"));
00910   rv=tsv.get(0,"col_01",&tmp_vec_d,':');
00911   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(tmp_vec_d.size()==3)&&
00912          (tmp_vec_d[0]==7.005005)&&(tmp_vec_d[1]==8.123456)&&(tmp_vec_d[2]==9.100000));;
00913 
00914   tsv.close();
00915 
00916 }

00918 void check_write_10()
00919 {
00920   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00921   tsv.defineColumn(0,0,"col_00");
00922   tsv.writeTsv_v1("./data-test-10.out");
00923   for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00924     tsv.set(0,0,i);
00925     tsv.writeLevel(0);
00926     // if you are debugging, you might want to explictly flush the output.
00927     // it is not required. Be warned that this slows down the IO.
00928     tsv.flush();
00929   }
00930   tsv.close();
00931 }
00932 
00933 void check_write_vec_1()
00934 {
00935   int rv;
00936 
00937   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00938   tsv.defineColumn(0,0,"col_00");
00939   tsv.defineColumn(0,1,"col_01");
00940   rv=tsv.writeTsv_v1("./data-test-4.out");
00941 
00942   //
00943   std::vector<int> vec_i;
00944   //
00945   vec_i.clear();
00946   vec_i.push_back(1); vec_i.push_back(2); vec_i.push_back(3);
00947   tsv.set(0,0,vec_i);
00948   vec_i.clear();
00949   vec_i.push_back(4); vec_i.push_back(5); vec_i.push_back(6);
00950   tsv.set(0,"col_01",vec_i);
00951   //
00952   tsv.writeLevel(0);
00953 
00954   //
00955   vec_i.clear();
00956   vec_i.push_back(7); vec_i.push_back(8); vec_i.push_back(9);
00957   tsv.set(0,0,vec_i);
00958   vec_i.clear();
00959   vec_i.push_back(10); vec_i.push_back(11); vec_i.push_back(12);
00960   tsv.set(0,"col_01",vec_i,':');
00961   //
00962   tsv.writeLevel(0);
00963 
00964   //
00965   std::vector<double> vec_d;
00966   vec_d.push_back(7.0050051);
00967   vec_d.push_back(8.123456);
00968   vec_d.push_back(9.1);  
00969   //
00970   tsv.setPrecision(0,0,3);
00971   tsv.set(0,0,vec_d);
00972   //
00973   tsv.setPrecision(0,"col_01",6);
00974   tsv.set(0,"col_01",vec_d,':');
00975   //
00976   tsv.writeLevel(0);
00977 
00978   //
00979   tsv.close();
00980 }

00982 void check_read_colvec_1()
00983 {
00984   std::vector<std::string> colvec;
00985   affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec("data-test-3.tsv","val",&colvec,0);
00986   //
00987   if (0) {
00988     for (int i=0;i<colvec.size();i++) {
00989       printf("%2d: %s",i,colvec[i].c_str());
00990     }
00991   }
00992   assert(colvec.size()==9);
00993   assert(colvec[0]=="101");
00994   assert(colvec[3]=="404");
00995   assert(colvec[8]=="909");
00996 }
00997 
00998 void check_read_pgf_1()
00999 {
01000   affx::PgfFile pgf;
01001   std::string pgf_file="data-test-1.pgf";
01002 
01003   pgf.open(pgf_file);
01004   pgf.rewind();
01005   
01006   int probe_cnt=0;
01007   while (pgf.next_probeset()==affx::TSV_OK) {
01008     while (pgf.next_atom()==affx::TSV_OK) {
01009       while (pgf.next_probe()==affx::TSV_OK) {
01010         probe_cnt++;
01011       }
01012     }
01013   }
01014   printf("Pgf file '%s' has %d probes.\n",pgf_file.c_str(),probe_cnt);
01015 
01016   pgf.close();
01017 }

01033   check_escapeString();
01034   //
01035   check_field_name();
01036   check_empty();
01037   check_field_convert();
01038   check_field_vec_convert();
01039   //
01040   check_headers_1();
01041   check_headers_2();
01042   check_headers_3();
01043   check_headers_4();
01044   //
01045   check_read_table_1();
01046   //
01047   check_csv_1();
01048   //
01049   check_index_1();

01051   check_winpath_1();

01053   check_comment_1();
01054   //
01055   check_write_10();

01058   check_write_vec_1();
01059   //
01060   check_read_colvec_1();
01061   //
01062   check_read_pgf_1();
01063   //
01064   printf("ok.\n");
01065 }
